summary:
Salmonella is a type of bacteria that can make people sick. It is named after a scientist, Daniel Salmon. These bacteria are very small, rod-shaped, and can move. They can be found in food that has been contaminated with feces. 

Some types of Salmonella cause serious illnesses like typhoid fever, which can be life-threatening and needs urgent medical care. Others lead to an illness called salmonellosis, which is usually less severe and can be treated without antibiotics. Salmonella can come from animals and spread between people.
title: Salmonella
